Support for MSMEs facing U.S. tariff headwinds and accelerating ease of doing business initiatives are also anticipated.

articles.title: Sandip Sabharwal sees stable earnings season as IT and banks hold firm
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are experiencing cautious stability during the earnings season, with IT and financials under scrutiny. While overall earnings are steady, extraordinary write-offs are distorting results. The wires and cables segment stands out with robust growth, unlike other construction-related sectors, as demand remains strong despite rising copper prices.

The FY27 fiscal deficit is seen around 4.2% of GDP, though a higher 4.4% could signal a growth push, supporting equities but pressuring bond yields.

articles.summary: The two governments have intensified discussions to select the initial projects ‌under the ‌investment scheme, agreed as part of Tokyo's deal with Washington to lower tariffs on Japanese exports ‌to the United States, the sources said on Monday.

articles.title: Malaysia's Khazanah to steer more capital to power grids, chip firms, chief says in Davos
articles.summary: Surging AI computing needs were reshaping what is "investable" in the AI boom, with energy supply and grid resilience being central to ‌competitiveness, Khazanah ‌Managing Director Amirul Feisal Wan Zahir said in an interview at the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos.

articles.title: Taylor Swift label UMG inks licensing deal with China's NetEase Cloud Music
articles.summary: The ‌multi-year license ‌agreement allows UMG-signed artists like Taylor ‌Swift to stream on NetEase's platform. The deal includes provisions and terms covering artificial intelligence both companies ​said reflect a "shared ​commitment to responsible AI practices ‌that ‍support and protect the ‍music and artists that UMG represents," ‌in a statement announcing the deal.

articles.title: X to award $1 million to top article in push for long-form writing
articles.summary: This comes months after X rolled out Articles, which allows creators to publish long-form posts beyond the traditional character limit, and is in line with Musk’s intention to make X an “everything app” — a platform that integrates media, payments, and publishing in one.

articles.title: Dealmaking via Mauritius may be a road less taken
articles.summary: The Supreme Court’s ruling against Tiger Global could reshape how foreign investors use Mauritius-based entities to invest in India. Funds must now show genuine “substance” in these jurisdictions, or face Indian tax scrutiny. The verdict may also affect other treaty-based investments and indirect share transfers in Indian companies.

articles.title: Manufacturing sector 'steady' amid tariffs and other geopolitical worries: FICCI Survey
articles.summary: India's manufacturing sector shows sustained growth and optimism, with 91% reporting higher or same production levels in Q3 FY 2025-26. Domestic demand is also strong, with 86% anticipating increased orders. Despite capacity utilization near 75%, global and operational challenges are noted, though export expectations remain positive.

articles.title: Budget 2026 and why stability, not scale, matters in today’s fractured global order
articles.summary: India's democratic institutions offer a rare competitive edge in a volatile global economy. As geopolitical risks reshape trade, regulatory certainty and predictable processes are paramount for attracting investment. Reforms in customs, export controls, and stakeholder consultation are crucial for building a trustworthy, rules-based economic ecosystem, shielding currency risks from becoming investment hesitations.

articles.title: Trump effect: Cotton fabrics exports drop 30%
articles.summary: Indian cotton textile exports saw a sharp fall after the US introduced tariffs in August 2025. Shipments dropped by nearly 30 percent following the levy. This decline impacted all categories, including fabrics, made-ups, and ready-made garments. Companies are exploring strategies like discounts to mitigate the impact. The situation is expected to remain volatile for some time.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Prudence, not populism, will be underlying theme to build Bharat
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: The upcoming Union Budget in 2026 is expected to prioritize fiscal prudence over populism, focusing on expenditure management and consolidation. While growth remains a priority, moderate increases in capital expenditure and targeted social welfare programs are anticipated. The budget will likely maintain continuity in tax structures, with potential adjustments to customs tariffs influenced by global trade dynamics.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India’s power shift hinges on fixing a crisis millions complain about
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget on February 1, with jobs expected to be a central focus. India currently has a demographic advantage, with more working-age people than dependents, but translating this into steady employment is critical for the nation’s economic and global ambitions.

articles.title: Centre likely to prioritise debt consolidation, capex push in Budget 2026: ICRA
articles.summary: The upcoming Union Budget for 2026-27 is expected to prioritize medium-term debt consolidation while maintaining a strong push for capital expenditure. ICRA projects a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP, with a significant increase in capital spending to Rs 13.1 trillion, aiming to front-load infrastructure development before future fiscal rigidities.

articles.title: Union Budget: CII seeks infrastructure, R&D push to sustain India’s growth
articles.summary: Industry leaders are urging the government to use the upcoming Union Budget for 2026-27. They want reforms in infrastructure, innovation, digital systems, and finance. This aims to keep India as the world's fastest-growing economy. Business confidence is high, driven by domestic demand. The budget proposals focus on capital expenditure and talent attraction.

articles.title: This Budget could be the spark behind India’s AI power shift
articles.summary: India's Union Budget 2026 arrives as the nation focuses on AI execution. Industry leaders seek structural reforms for power, approvals, and policy certainty. Clear governance, risk frameworks, and scalable compute access are crucial. The budget must foster domestic AI growth, support Indian languages, and position the government as a key customer to drive innovation and global leadership.

articles.title: Dow futures sink over 600 points; Trump’s Greenland move drags Europe, Asian markets
articles.summary: Global markets tumbled Tuesday as U.S. futures indicated sharp declines following President Trump's threat of new tariffs on eight European countries. Asian shares mostly fell, with Tokyo's Nikkei down 1.1% amid election speculation and rising bond yields. European markets also opened lower, reflecting concerns over trade tensions and corporate earnings.

articles.title: Nifty faces resistance below 26,000; PSU banks and metals offer better risk-reward, says Gautam Shah
articles.summary: Indian markets remain range-bound below 26,000, but key support at 25,450 could trigger a rebound, says Gautam Shah, Founder of Goldilocks Global Research. PSU banks and metals offer better risk-reward amid fair valuations, while FMCG and IT stocks remain expensive. Selective, concentrated investing is key as markets await budget-led triggers.

articles.title: Japan bond yields surge to records as election stokes fiscal concerns; stocks and yen fall
articles.summary: Japanese government bonds (JGBs) plunged, sending ⁠yields to record highs, while Tokyo stocks and the yen also fell after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's calling of a snap election shook confidence in the country's fiscal health.

articles.title: Eternal Q3 Preview: Earnings set to grow 50% YoY; Blinkit losses persist
articles.summary: Eternal anticipates strong growth in the December quarter. Blinkit's shift to a first-party model and quick commerce are key drivers. Food delivery shows steady demand and improving margins. Blinkit's rapid expansion continues, but losses persist. Hyperpure also sees growth. Analysts will watch competitive intensity and Blinkit's path to profitability.

articles.title: Arohan Financial Services plans to hit capital market during middle of 2026-27 with Rs 1,500 cr IPO
articles.summary: Arohan Financial Services plans to launch an Initial Public Offering (IPO) of Rs 1,500 crore in the second quarter of the next financial year. The NBFC-MFI aims to raise Rs 750 crore through fresh shares and Rs 750 crore via an offer for sale by existing investors. The company is also looking to diversify into secured lending products.

articles.title: Shadowfax Technologies IPO Day 1 Update: Subscribed 15%, GMP indicates 6% listing gains. Should you invest?
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies’ IPO opened with 15% subscription on Day 1, driven by strong retail interest. Grey market premium suggests a 6% listing gain, though sentiment has cooled. Analysts advise a neutral stance amid premium valuations.

articles.title: Bitcoin slips to $91,000 as US–EU trade war escalation weighs on sentiment
articles.summary: Bitcoin slipped to the $91,000 level amid risk-off sentiment triggered by escalating US–EU trade tensions. Broader crypto markets remained subdued as liquidations flushed out leverage, while analysts noted continued consolidation within a wide range, with macro cues and policy signals likely to drive the next directional move.

articles.title: Dr Reddy's Q3 preview: PAT may fall 22% YoY as US pressure to weigh on earnings
articles.summary: Dr Reddy's Laboratories anticipates a subdued performance for the December quarter. Pressure from its United States business is expected to offset steady growth in India and Europe. Analysts predict a decline in revenue and profit after tax. The US market faces challenges from pricing pressure and reduced contribution from gRevlimid.

articles.title: Japan bond yields soar as election promises stir fiscal fears
articles.summary: Japanese government bond yields have reached record highs. This surge is driven by worries over potential tax cuts ahead of an election. These cuts could strain government finances. A weak auction for 20-year debt has intensified the sell-off. Market participants are cautious, with no clear buyers at current levels. Political uncertainty and fiscal outlook are key concerns.

articles.title: HDFC Bank’s forced balancing act drags stock, makes it Nifty Bank’s biggest laggard. What to do?
articles.summary: HDFC Bank shares remain under pressure despite in-line Q3 results as deposit concerns and a stretched CD ratio weigh on sentiment. Brokerages stay constructive, citing medium-term growth visibility, valuation comfort, and gradual normalisation of balance sheet metrics.

articles.title: Trump tariff threat casts shadow over Germany’s fragile recovery
articles.summary: Industry groups in Germany have responded with alarm, warning that such measures would strain transatlantic relations and damage both sides. Business associations criticised the escalation as harmful and unnecessary, stressing that political disputes should not spill over into trade. Exporters and wholesalers also voiced strong support for Denmark, underscoring that democratic principles should not be undermined by economic pressure.

articles.title: Budget 2026: The arithmetic that will decide India’s bond market
articles.summary: Budget 2026 will be crucial for India’s bond market, with investors seeking fiscal continuity, credible deficit targets and transparent consolidation. Borrowing strategy, capex execution, and small savings flows will shape yields, while improved market microstructure gains importance amid deferred global index inclusion, making trust between fiscal policy and markets essential.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO at 1,000x P/E: What are investors hopes for listing gains?
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies' IPO opens with a high valuation, trading at over 1,000 times its latest earnings. Despite a premium valuation compared to peers like Blue Dart Express and Delhivery, analysts point to strong revenue growth and an asset-light model as potential drivers.

articles.title: Markets watch closely as US top court takes up Fed independence test
articles.summary: The US Supreme Court is set to hear a landmark case that could test the Federal Reserve’s independence, as it examines whether a president can remove a Fed governor. The case, stemming from Donald Trump’s attempt to oust Governor Lisa Cook, could either reinforce the central bank’s insulation from political pressure or clarify how presidents might lawfully exert control, potentially redefining the limits of presidential authority over monetary policy.

articles.title: Tariff threats revive ‘Sell America’ fears as Trump rekindles trade war jitters
articles.summary: Tariff threats from President Trump have revived “Sell America” fears as markets brace for renewed trade war tensions. European equities fell, the dollar weakened, and safe-haven currencies gained, while investors assess the risk of escalated U.S.–EU retaliation and potential shifts in European exposure to U.S. assets, Reuters reported.

articles.title: UPL subsidiary Advanta Enterprises files draft IPO papers with Sebi
articles.summary: UPL’s seed business Advanta Enterprises has filed draft IPO papers with Sebi for a proposed offer for sale, allowing the agrochemicals group and other shareholders to partially monetise their holdings amid an active Indian primary market.

articles.title: More pain ahead? Top 10 retail-dominated stocks crash up to 43% as Indian markets underperformed since one year
articles.summary: Retail-dominated Indian stocks have experienced significant declines, with top performers crashing up to 43% since June 2024. This sharp correction, particularly in stocks with high retail ownership, highlights the vulnerability of crowded trades when market momentum shifts. Several prominent companies across sectors like infrastructure, green energy, and IT have seen substantial losses.

articles.title: From housing affordability to green buildings: what real estate expects from Budget 2026
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 nears, India's real estate sector seeks policy continuity, fiscal support, and structural reforms to sustain growth. Industry leaders emphasize affordability, infrastructure, capital access, and regulatory efficiency to boost confidence across residential, commercial, and mixed-use segments, positioning real estate as a key driver of urban transformation and economic progress.

articles.title: Brokerages initiate coverage on Meesho, Groww, Angel One, 8 other stocks this week. How many do you have?
articles.summary: Brokerages have started covering eleven Indian stocks this week. Analysts are positive on companies like Groww, Angel One, and Meesho. They predict potential gains of up to 51% for some stocks. This coverage includes companies in broking, insurance, and hospitality sectors. Investors can find new opportunities with these initiated reports.

articles.title: Markets muted, select opportunities emerge amid volatility: Sunny Agrawal
articles.summary: Indian stock markets are experiencing weakness. Experts advise investors to focus on companies with strong earnings growth. The auto and auto ancillary sectors show promise. Mid-sized banks are also performing well. Investors can find opportunities in quality stocks for medium-term gains. Long-term investors can look at sectors like steel.

articles.title: Aditya Birla Fashion shares slide 9% after reports of Rs 289 crore block deal
articles.summary: Shares of Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail slid to a 52-week low after a Rs 289 crore block deal, as reports pointed to a clean-out trade by an undisclosed institutional investor.

articles.title: Rupee falls 8 paise to 90.98 against US dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The rupee weakened by 8 paise to 90.98 against the US dollar in early trade Tuesday, driven by strong dollar demand from metal importers and consistent foreign fund outflows. Geopolitical uncertainty and a sluggish domestic stock market, fueled by foreign capital exodus, further pressured the Indian currency.

articles.title: India’s earnings recovery priced in; Venugopal Garre explains why markets now need upgrades, not optimism
articles.summary: Indian equities may see moderate gains, but sharp upside looks limited as earnings recovery is already priced in, says Bernstein’s Venugopal Garre. With margins near peak levels, weak nominal growth and limited fiscal headroom, markets now need clear earnings upgrade triggers, not just recovery hopes, to drive stronger returns in 2026 and beyond.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra AMC, Aequitas among top 10 equity PMS performers in 2025. Full list here
articles.summary: In December 2025, Indian equities saw volatile trading with investors favoring selective strategies. East Green Advisors' Quant Strategy led the top 10 equity PMS performers with an 8.33% return. Kotak Mahindra AMC's Fintech and Aequitas' India Opportunities Product also featured prominently among the top performers.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: Gold prices near Rs 1.50 lakh, silver up Rs 7,900 as Greenland concerns drive rally. Too late to buy?
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices surged to record highs on Tuesday, driven by renewed trade war concerns following US President Donald Trump's tariff threats linked to Greenland. Investors sought safe-haven assets amid heightened global uncertainty. While prices later pared some gains, volatility is expected to persist.

articles.title: Wipro among 7 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
articles.summary: A sharp increase in futures open interest indicates a rise in the number of active, unexpired contracts in a security.

articles.title: Selling spree! Dolly Khanna trims stake in 5 stocks, exits one in Q3. Do you own any?
articles.summary: Ace investor Dolly Khanna has adopted a cautious approach in Q3 FY26, trimming stakes in five stocks and potentially exiting one. She has also added IFB Agro Industries to her portfolio. This move comes amid a generally cautious market sentiment.

articles.title: Rs 8,600 crore selloff! Infosys most sold stock by mutual funds in December. Time for a U-turn?
articles.summary: Mutual funds divested Rs 8,600 crore of Infosys shares in December. The IT major has since reported better-than-expected Q3 results and increased its full-year growth forecast. This performance is now attracting investor attention, signaling a potential stabilization in the stock's outlook. Analysts are revising targets upwards, anticipating accelerated growth driven by AI services.

articles.title: PB Fintech among 4 stocks flashing bullish signals, hinting at a possible uptrend

Its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio stands at 3.49, while the price-to-book (P/B) ratio is 4.73, indicating how the market values the company relative to its earnings, revenue, and net worth.

articles.title: BCCL to fund expansion through internal accruals despite OFS IPO; targets 3x realisation from coal washing
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal says it will fund expansion and modernisation through internal cash flows despite its IPO being a pure OFS. The Coal India subsidiary targets over ₹2,000 crore annual profit, plans to double coal washing capacity, and expects up to 3x realisation from washed coal, with growth driven by rising steel demand.

articles.summary: ACME Solar Holdings announced the commencement of commercial operations for 68 MW of its 100 MW wind power project in Gujarat. Implemented via its subsidiary, the project is backed by a long-term PPA with GUVNL, supporting stable revenues and strengthening ACME’s wind energy portfolio.

articles.title: The Golden Thumb Rule | Why missing the first 10% doesn’t matter in long-term investing: Deepak Shenoy
articles.summary: Deepak Shenoy of Capitalmind Mutual Fund advises long-term investors to avoid market timing, emphasizing that missing the first 10% of a move is a worthwhile trade-off for discipline. He stresses focusing on earnings growth and long-term trends over short-term noise and geopolitical events to navigate uncertain markets effectively.

articles.title: IHCL betting on boutique luxury and wellness as asset-light strategy drives margins and growth: Puneet Chhatwal
articles.summary: IHCL CEO Puneet Chhatwal explains the strategic rationale behind the Brij Hotels acquisition, the shift to an asset-light model, expansion into boutique luxury and wellness, margin outlook, capex plans of up to ₹10,000 crore, and how Indian Hotels aims to drive sustainable growth, higher ROCE and strong cash flows over the next five years.

articles.title: Fractional ownership and REITs are democratising commercial real estate: S.K. Sayal, Bharti Real Estate
articles.summary: India's commercial real estate is evolving with fractional ownership and REITs democratizing access to institutional-grade assets. Developers are focusing on integrated global business districts with strong infrastructure and walk-to-work ecosystems. The Delhi-NCR office leasing market remains robust, driven by demand for high-quality spaces from diverse sectors.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | Caution on gold, optimism on PSU banks and defence: Gaurav Bhandari’s 2026 market playbook
articles.summary: As markets brace for 2026, Monarch Networth Capital CEO Gaurav Bhandari advises caution on speculative gold and silver rallies. He remains constructive on Indian equities, particularly PSU banks and defence, citing strong fundamentals and government support.

articles.title: Havells India among 4 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
Everstone-backed Wingify acquires AB Tasty to create $500-million SaaS firm
articles.summary: Wingify (through its flagship product VWO) and AB Tasty offer software used by product, marketing and growth teams in enterprises to improve their websites and apps by testing what works best for users. As part of the deal, Everstone Capital will buy out stakes from certain shareholders of AB Tasty to continue holding a majority in the merged entity, Gupta said, without disclosing the financials of the transaction.

articles.title: VC firm Avaana Capital appoints Vikas Verma as partner, promotes Shruti Srivastava
articles.summary: Founded in 2018, Avaana Capital has backed startups such as Aerem, Amperehour, Eeki Foods, Kazam, Turno and GreenGrahi, and has previously invested in companies such as Agnikul, Delhivery, Nykaa and Urban Company. The fund’s focus areas include deeptech entrepreneurs building in the fields of energy, mobility and supply chains, advanced manufacturing, AI and robotics.

articles.title: Inside China's buzzing AI scene year after DeepSeek shock
articles.summary: Before DeepSeek shook up the tech world and put Chinese artificial intelligence on the map, Wu Chenglin's own startup had nearly folded three times -- but in the past year it has raised $30 million. But as excitement around DeepSeek fuelled a boom in spending, Wu raised 220 million yuan in two funding rounds.

articles.title: Britain needs 'AI stress tests' for financial services, lawmakers say
articles.summary: In a report on AI in financial services, the Treasury Committee said the Financial Conduct Authority and the Bank of England should start running AI‑specific stress tests to help firms ‌prepare for ‌market shocks triggered by automated systems.

articles.title: Living with AI | How I use ChatGPT to plan travel: Rohit Bansal
articles.summary: I begin by giving it context: myself and wife traveling along with two children aged 10 and 12, an interest in being outdoors, and a low tolerance for long stretches of inactivity, writes Rohit Bansal.

articles.title: Republic Day to lift ecommerce sales; Shadowfax nets anchor funds
articles.summary: Happy Tuesday! Ecommerce sales are set to rise during this year’s Republic Day sale season. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.summary: AI travel influencers are here, can they coexist with human creators? ET finds out.

articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Senores Pharma Q3 results: Shares fall 6% despite strong operating performance, margin expansion
articles.summary: Senores Pharma reported a strong Q3 with net profit rising 88% to ₹32 crore and margins expanding to 31%. Shares, however, fell over 5% despite record emerging markets performance.

articles.title: Russia’s Kamchatka faces snow apocalypse as Sea of Okhotsk cyclones shatter 130-year record
articles.summary: Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula is grappling with unprecedented snowfall triggered by powerful Sea of Okhotsk cyclones, burying neighbourhoods under deep drifts, disrupting transport in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, and prompting authorities to impose a regional state of emergency.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Mahindra & Mahindra plans to list Electric three-wheeler business in 2027, Anish Shah says | Exclusive
articles.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra plans to list its electric three-wheeler business in 2027, aiming to fund growth, as Anish Shah highlights electric mobility and resilience at Davos.

articles.title: PwC Global CEO Survey: Key takeaways on what Indian CEOs think about growth, risks, and AI
articles.summary: The PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey: India perspective shows that Indian CEOs are more optimistic about local growth, more active in expanding into new sectors, and more concerned about the speed of AI change. articles.title: Nifty Realty index sees the third-worst start to the year in a decade; Here are the worst performers

articles.title: Deposit growth back in double digits after two slow years, says Indian Overseas Bank CEO
articles.summary: Ajay Kumar Srivastava, MD & CEO, Indian Overseas Bank, said the bank has seen a strong pickup in deposits, with savings balances growing 11.36% year-on-year—the first double-digit growth in two years—while retail term deposits below ₹3 crore rose nearly 16%.

articles.title: Budget 2026 needs to be more than Aatmanirbhar
articles.summary: In a world where leverage beats values-based alliances, strategic autonomy is a necessity both for economic growth and diplomatic success. Therefore, the next budget must be anchored in foreign policy as much as local economic needs.

articles.title: Nitin Nabin is new BJP national president, PM Modi calls him 'boss'
articles.summary: Nitin Nabin, aged 45, was elected as the new national president of Bharatiya Janata Party, succeeding Jagat Prakash Nadda, with PM Modi and senior leaders present at the Delhi headquarters.

articles.title: Trump calls UK giving away Diego Garcia island as 'great stupidity', justifies Greenland acquisition
articles.summary: Donald Trump criticised the United Kingdom for giving Diego Garcia to Mauritius, calling it great stupidity and linking it to US plans for Greenland, stressing national security and global respect.

articles.title: India CEOs more confident than global peers, but increasingly wary of AI gaps and cyber risks: PwC survey
articles.summary: India CEOs show strong optimism for domestic growth and revenue, but face rising concerns over AI readiness, cybersecurity, and execution, according to PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey.

articles.title: HPCL shares downgraded by JPMorgan who warns of excise duty uncertainties

articles.title: TN Governor RN Ravi walks out of assembly, says 'was insulted, wasn't allowed to speak'
articles.summary: The Tamil Nadu Lok Bhavan alleged that the DMK government drafted address that contained “numerous unsubstantiated claims and misleading statements” while ignoring several pressing public concerns. Chief Minister MK Stalin strongly criticised the Governor RN's walkout. Read on:

articles.title: Mysterious ‘boiling’ water reported in Arabian Sea near Gujarat coast, probe on
articles.summary: The Palghar Disaster Management Cell is currently working with marine officials to investigate if the churning is caused by natural geological shifts or a human-caused industrial accident.

articles.title: Shadowfax sees 23-25% revenue growth as market share and value-added services expand
articles.summary: Shadowfax said its recent surge in growth was driven by higher consumption, wider digital adoption, and consolidation in the logistics sector. The company highlighted the growing contribution of value-added services such as same-day delivery and omnichannel logistics, which now form a large part of revenue and support profitability. It also said quick commerce is becoming a bigger part of its business, cash flows have turned positive, and client diversification risks have reduced as market condi

articles.title: IIFL spots CG Power, Netweb as selective bets amid copper pressure
articles.summary: Renu Baid Pugalia, Senior Vice President of Research at IIFL Institutional Equities, said the wires and cables market has matured enough to pass on cost increases on a weekly or fortnightly basis, a trend visible in the results of Polycab India and Havells India.

articles.title: Hindustan Zinc ramps up silver output as global deficit persists
articles.summary: Hindustan Zinc has already begun work on the first phase of its expansion and plans to announce the next stage, which includes new zinc, lead, and silver smelter capacity, in the next one to two months. The company expects to spend $4–5 billion on expansion and aims to fund this entirely through internal cash flows while remaining debt-free.

articles.title: JPMorgan’s Sanjay Mookim sees fewer earnings cuts, but expects India to lag global markets
articles.summary: JPMorgan’s Sanjay Mookim said earnings downgrades in India have eased for FY26, but growth is likely to trail global markets, especially after currency adjustment. He expects limited support for capex stocks due to fiscal constraints and continues to favour consumer discretionary sectors. Equity supply is also likely to remain high in 2026, which could limit market upside.

articles.title: Skoda reveals Kushaq facelift in India with standard electric sunroof, new 8-speed AT
articles.summary: Skoda Auto India has unveiled the Kushaq facelift ahead of prices and opened bookings for its updated mid-size SUV, with a standard electric sunroof and a new eight-speed automatic gearbox.

articles.title: IKEA debuts in Tamil Nadu with online delivery starting January 22
articles.summary: The move comes as the company noted strong enthusiasm from the state as spotted through online searches and social media sentiment among other things.

articles.title: Zydus Life may acquire US-firm Ardelyx, may raise funds via QIP to part-fund deal: Exclusive
articles.summary: CNBC-TV18 reached out to both, Zydus Life and Ardelyx. While the former said it cannot comment on the speculation, a response from Ardelyx is awaited.

articles.title: Yes Bank targets margin stability, 8% loan growth in FY26
articles.summary: Prashant Kumar, Managing Director and CEO of Yes Bank, said gold loans are an attractive asset class and part of the bank’s long-term strategy, even though the lender is not currently present in the segment. He added that Yes Bank plans to roll out gold loan offerings across its branches in FY27.

articles.title: PNB sees credit growth strengthening, margins set to recover
articles.summary: Ashok Chandra, MD & CEO of Punjab National Bank, said the corporate loan book grew 8.9% in the October-December quarter of 2025 (Q3FY26), and added that with the ongoing calibration, the bank expects to return to double-digit growth in corporate lending.

articles.title: India, EU set to conclude Free Trade Deal by Jan 27
articles.summary: Negotiators have struck a balance on sensitive areas with agriculture and dairy sectors respecting both sides’ red lines, while the EU has agreed to provide greater market access for Indian labour-intensive exports.

articles.title: IRFC eyes higher margins as it expands beyond Indian Railways
articles.summary: After a strong performance in the first nine months of FY26, Manoj Kumar Dubey, Chairman & Managing Director of IRFC, said the company has already met its full-year asset sanction target of ₹60,000 crore. He added that fresh deals in the March quarter could take total sanctions closer to ₹80,000 crore, while disbursements are on track to cross the ₹30,000 crore mark for the year.

articles.title: Trump agrees to hold meeting with countries over Greenland after call with NATO Secy Gen
articles.summary: Donald Trump plans a Davos meeting with global leaders over his Greenland takeover bid, as NORAD deploys aircraft to Pituffik Space Base amid rising tensions and calls for US-led world security.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh CM N. Chandrababu Naidu confirms new spaceport at Hope Island for private launch missions
articles.summary: The site is expected to primarily support private launch providers, adding to India’s expanding launch infrastructure.

articles.title: PhysicsWallah shares drop 8%, extend losses back towards IPO price
articles.summary: As of 11 am IST, around 44 lakh shares had changed hands. The sharp sell-off has dragged PhysicsWallah's market capitalisation down to ₹32,257 crore, lower than the nearly ₹45,975 crore valuation at the time of its listing.

articles.title: CEAT to invest ₹1,300 crore to expand capacity to 60,000 tyres a day
articles.summary: CEAT expects its value growth this year to remain in the mid-teens, supported by performance in the first three quarters, according to MD and CEO Arnab Banerjee. For the medium term, the company is preparing for at least double-digit growth by expanding in the US market and strengthening its domestic business through original equipment approvals and a wider presence in the replacement segment, especially in the sports utility vehicle (SUV) category.

articles.title: What it would take for India to be a high-income country by 2047
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a goal for India to become a developed nation by 2047. Based on recent trends and estimates, here’s a snapshot of the growth rate required to achieve that goal.

articles.title: Deepak Nitrite shares gain up to 6% after arm commissions ₹85 crore plant in Dahej, Gujarat
articles.summary: Shares of Deepak Nitrite have snapped a seven-day losing streak in today's trading session. The stock is bucking the trend in an otherwise weak market, gaining on strong volumes as well.

articles.title: Chinese visitors to Japan slump 45% in December amid dispute
articles.summary: Chinese visitors to Japan fell 45 percent in December after Sanae Takaichi's Taiwan comments, impacting tourism revenue and retail, as tensions rise between Tokyo and Beijing.

articles.title: Havells India CMD warns of short-term demand impact due to commodity price surge

articles.title: Top US Catholic cardinals question morality of American foreign policy
articles.summary: Cardinals Blase Cupich, Robert McElroy and Joseph Tobin urge a moral US foreign policy, criticising military action and echoing Pope Leo's concerns over Venezuela, Ukraine and Greenland.

articles.title: Rare historic solar radiation storm hits Earth after two decades, Aurora displays likely
articles.summary: According to US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), sustained or intensifying G4 conditions could cause the auroral oval to expand significantly, potentially making the northern lights visible across much of the United States. Read on:

articles.title: FMCG demand stabilises after GST reset, but recovery remains uneven

Key focus areas include unified retail regulations, green energy investments, AI adoption, digital finance, housing affordability, research-led education, and climate resilience—sectors poised to define India’s economic trajectory over the next decade.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Experts pinpoint key growth opportunities across sectors

articles.title: Tiger Global case: Why tax experts fear more disputes for foreign investors
articles.summary: Himanshu Sinha, Partner – Tax Practice at Trilegal, took a sharper view, describing the Supreme Court ruling as largely unexpected and disruptive. He said the decision marks a significant shift in India’s tax treaty jurisprudence as it allows tax authorities to look past administrative assurances and reassess the commercial substance of long-standing investment structures.

Authorities have filed an FIR against developers and formed an SIT to investigate the incident and rescue delays.

articles.title: From party worker to its president: Nitin Nabin becomes BJP's youngest chief — 10 things to know
articles.summary: The BJP on Monday declared Nabin as its sole candidate for the post after the nomination and scrutiny process concluded without any rival contenders. This cleared the path for his unopposed election as the party’s 12th national president. In a late-night statement, BJP National Returning Officer K. Laxman said that only Nabin’s name remained after the completion of nominations and the withdrawal window, confirming his election by consensus.

articles.title: Punjab government approves modernisation of bus terminals in five districts
articles.summary: Punjab is set to modernize its major bus terminals in Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Sangrur, Patiala, and Bathinda through a Public Private Partnership. This initiative aims to significantly enhance passenger facilities, safety, and overall efficiency at these vital transport hubs. The upgrades will focus on improved waiting areas, sanitation, accessibility, and integrated commercial spaces, ensuring better connectivity for millions daily.

articles.title: Tobacco puts 1 in 10 at oral cancer risk among Nicobarese in India
articles.summary: A study on Car Nicobar Island revealed that nearly 10% of Nicobarese adults have oral lesions potentially leading to cancer, primarily linked to high smokeless tobacco and alcohol consumption. Researchers found these concerning rates concentrated within this specific community, highlighting urgent needs for targeted screening and cessation programs.

articles.title: Hope against Chikungunya: ICMR steps in as cases rise across India
articles.summary: The Indian Council of Medical Research is fast-tracking an experimental RNA-based antiviral therapy for Chikungunya, inviting Indian companies to develop and manufacture it. Developed by ICMR's National Institute of Virology, the therapy showed complete viral suppression in pre-clinical studies by targeting essential viral genes.

articles.title: High drama in Tamil Nadu assembly: Governor R N Ravi walks out; alleges 'national anthem insulted'
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi staged a walkout from the state assembly, citing disrespect for the National Anthem and his microphone being switched off. Raj Bhavan alleged the speech ignored critical issues like Dalit atrocities. This marks a repeat of a similar incident last year, intensifying political tensions ahead of upcoming elections.

articles.title: Tushar Ahluwalia raises $12 million for AI venture out of stealth
articles.summary: Tushar Ahluwalia's new AI startup, GeneralMind, has secured $12 million in early-stage funding just months after launching. The company offers an autonomous workflow automation platform for enterprises, integrating with legacy ERP systems to automate repetitive operational tasks. Several major listed enterprises are already utilizing GeneralMind's technology.

articles.title: Too risky? Why India should not join Trump’s $1 billion ‘Board of Peace’; GTRI flags key issues
articles.summary: India faces a strategic dilemma as the US invites it to join the Gaza Peace Board, a US-led initiative for post-war reconstruction. A GTRI report urges caution, citing concerns over political imbalance, bypassing UN norms, and potential commercial interests overshadowing Palestinian rights. The report highlights risks to India's credibility.

articles.title: Price today: Gold nears Rs 1.5 lakh mark, silver surges - what’s fueling the rally?
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices reached record highs Tuesday, driven by fears of a US-EU trade war following US President Trump's tariff threats. Investors sought safe-haven assets amid heightened global uncertainty. Both metals saw significant gains on MCX and in international markets, with silver hitting a lifetime high.

articles.title: Asian stocks today: Markets trade mostly in red; Nikkei sheds 1%, HSI remains flat
articles.summary: Asian markets opened lower Tuesday amid renewed trade tensions and political developments in Japan. Investors reacted to US President Trump's tariff threats and a potential parliamentary dissolution in Japan, which boosted government bond yields. Attention now shifts to US corporate earnings and inflation data ahead of the Federal Reserve's meeting.

articles.title: Gold price prediction today: Will gold & silver prices continue to climb new highs? What investors should watch out for
articles.summary: Gold price prediction today: Praveen Singh of Mirae Asset Sharekhan says that gold prices may have faced downward pressure in the near term, had it not been for the heightened geopolitical tensions. Here’s his outlook on gold prices:

articles.title: Budget 2026 income tax: What middle class, salaried taxpayers want from FM Sitharaman - top wishlist
articles.summary: Budget 2026 expectations: The government had in the past considered the option of one uniform ITR form for all taxpayers, to make tax filing simpler and user friendly. It is desirable that the same be re-evaluated.

articles.title: India-UAE energy ties boost: ADNOC and HPCL seal $2.5 billion gas deal; New Delhi to receive half a million tonnes of LNG annually
articles.summary: India and the UAE have inked a significant energy pact, with ADNOC Gas agreeing to supply Hindustan Petroleum with over $2.5 billion worth of liquefied natural gas annually for ten years. This deal positions India as ADNOC Gas's largest customer.

articles.title: Russia witnesses record winter: Entire neighbourhoods buried under mountain of snow — watch
articles.summary: Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia is grappling with unprecedented snowfall, burying homes and roads under metres of snow. Record-breaking storms have paralyzed daily life, with drifts reaching up to five metres. Authorities have declared a state of emergency after two fatalities, and avalanche risks are high. Transport remains severely disrupted as residents battle extraordinary winter conditions.

articles.title: India's central bank proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies
articles.summary: India will host the summit, which will be held later this year. If ‌the recommendation is accepted, ‌a proposal to link the digital currencies of BRICS members would be put forward for the first time. The RBI's proposal builds ​on a 2025 declaration at a BRICS summit in Rio de Janeiro, which pushed for interoperability between members' payment systems ​to make cross-border transactions more efficient.

articles.title: US Commerce Secretary warns some Korean, Taiwanese firms may face 100% chip tariffs unless they invest in US
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick warned South Korean and Taiwanese chipmakers of 100% tariffs unless they expand manufacturing in America. The Trump administration is using trade deals and tariff threats to push investment, while temporarily pausing broad semiconductor levies. Micron’s vast US expansion underlines the approach as Samsung and SK Hynix weigh responses.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal meets US Ambassador Sergio Gor, Senator Steve Daines; discusses bilateral issues
articles.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Ambassador Sergio Gor and Senator Steve Daines to discuss bilateral issues, including ongoing trade agreement negotiations. The discussions come amidst a 50% US import duty on Indian goods and US senators' calls for favorable provisions for American pulse crop producers in any future trade deal.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP growth of 7.3% to boost average household income, insurance demand: Moody’s
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.3 per cent in FY 2025. This robust expansion will boost household incomes and drive demand for insurance. The insurance sector anticipates sustained premium growth due to economic strength, digitisation, and planned reforms. Increased risk awareness and easier product access are also contributing factors.

articles.title: RBI proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies, sources say
articles.summary: India's central bank has proposed linking BRICS nations' digital currencies to facilitate cross-border trade and tourism payments, potentially reducing reliance on the U.S. dollar. This initiative, to be discussed at the 2026 BRICS summit, builds on previous calls for payment system interoperability among member states.

articles.title: National Highway builders ask Finmin to clarify arbitration order
articles.summary: The National Highway Builders Federation has urged the finance ministry to clarify its order ending arbitration for highway projects. The federation warns this change discourages investment and increases project costs. It suggests the new dispute resolution framework could make projects unbankable. This impacts ongoing projects and future infrastructure development. The federation is also flagging concerns with bankers and financial lenders.

articles.title: CII's Biz Confidence Index climbs to five-quarter high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: Business confidence in India is soaring, reaching a five-quarter high. Firms are optimistic about demand, profitability, and investment. GST rate cuts and festive spending are boosting sales. The industry expects the Reserve Bank of India to cut repo rates. CII suggests continued reforms and infrastructure investment for sustained growth.

articles.title: How Budget 2026 can help India strike the right balance in trade policy for a world in flux
articles.summary: India's trade strategy is at a critical juncture, shifting from broad liberalization to selective engagement. New trade pacts diversify markets, while domestic initiatives like PLI schemes build manufacturing strength. The upcoming Union Budget must focus on enhancing access, ensuring assurance in supply chains, and fostering agility to navigate global trade disruptions and secure India's competitive edge.

articles.title: Will dal derail deal? New irritant looms over India-US trade talks
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: US senators are urging Trump to push India to remove tariffs on American pulse exports. This demand touches upon India's agricultural policies and its goal of self-reliance in pulses. India's decision to impose tariffs was to protect its farmers. This could complicate the ongoing trade deal negotiations.

articles.title: CRISIL flags strong headwinds for merchandise exports
articles.summary: Indian merchandise exports face challenges from the US-India trade deal stalemate and possible US sanctions on Russian crude oil. Tea and basmati rice may see pressure. However, the current account deficit is projected to stay manageable due to strong services trade and remittances.

articles.title: India-US trade deal: US lawmakers urge President Trump to seek lower Indian tariffs on pulse crops in BTA talks
articles.summary: American lawmakers have asked President Trump to seek better terms for pulse crops in trade talks with India. They state that Indian tariffs put US producers at a disadvantage. India is a major consumer of pulses like lentils and chickpeas. The lawmakers recall past efforts to address this issue. They believe favorable provisions will benefit both countries.

articles.title: GTRI calls for overhaul of tariff structure, customs to boost India's trade
articles.summary: A new report by GTRI urges India to overhaul its import tariffs and customs administration to boost manufacturing and exports. The think-tank suggests simplifying duties, eliminating complex notifications, and creating a growth-focused customs system. These reforms are crucial as India's trade volume grows and global supply chains shift.

articles.title: US Senators pitch for favourable pulse crop provision in potential India-US trade pact
articles.summary: In a letter dated January 16, 2026, US Senators Kevin Cramer and Steve Daines have encouraged the US President "to push for favourable pulse crop provisions in any agreement the United States" signs with India as trade negotiations progress.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry: India-US trade talks progressing, no fixed deadline yet
articles.summary: India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement talks are “very near” conclusion, but Commerce Ministry says no deadline can be set. Exports impacted by US tariffs are being managed through diversification and FTAs.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Revamping auto PLI can unlock EV growth, says Deloitte India

articles.title: India needs inflation again: Why nominal GDP, not real growth, is the real Budget 2026 challenge
articles.summary: As India heads into Budget 2026, economists are rethinking long-held assumptions about growth and stability. With inflation at multi-decade lows and nominal GDP losing momentum, policymakers face a new challenge: reviving revenues, earnings and debt dynamics in a world where disinflation may be structural rather than cyclical.

articles.title: Fix the tax collector, not the tax rate: Dhruva Advisors' Budget 2026 pitch
articles.summary: As the finance ministry readies Budget 2026, Dhruva Advisors has urged a decisive shift towards cleaner tax administration, calling for predictable interpretations, streamlined TDS rates, and a rethink of legacy mechanisms such as TCS. The firm argues that targeted tax incentives for AI, semiconductor manufacturing, and research are essential to improve investor confidence and lift India’s long-term innovation capacity.
